Comment: Classifier meaning 'cavity', as in tɨ̃ykɨ̃y, 'tooth's cavity'. See 'cave' 01.280. Cf. *Tupí-G.
E. g., a 'head'. arɨbɨ̃ŋ-bɨ̃ŋ refers to things such as a 'bucket'; awaketkɨt to a 'plate'. The suffixes ʔaʔa and ya are classifiers for 'round (objects)'. Cf. 'head' 04.200. Cf. *Tupí-G.
E.g. a 'board'. tičɨ̃ŋ refers to something as a 'river'; -kɨŋ lɨŋ, as a 'dress'.
E.g. a 'board'. tiwãbɨboŋ refers to something as a 'river'; -põŋ-bõŋ as a 'dress'.
Also abik. Kuruáya dialect is abig. Cf. *Tupí-G.
Used as a classifier. Kuruáya dialect is bɛ. Cf. *Tupí-G.
The former means 'take hold of'. Cf. *Tupí-G.
The former means 'take hold of'. Cf. *Tupí-G.
The former means 'take hold of'. Cf. *Tupí-G.
Kuruáya dialect is oaĩ; wãy. Cf. *Tupi-G.
Also ǰẽm; čẽm-čẽm; oʔǰẽm; i-wat. Cf. *Tupí-G.
Also e-ǰot; ot. Kuruáya dialect is ud. Cf. *Tupí-G.
Also e-ǰot; ot. Kuruáya dialect is ud. Cf. *Tupí-G.
Also e-ǰot; ot. Kuruáya dialect is ud. Cf. *Tupí-G.
Reduplication of single V stem is -hVm. Cf. Tupí-G.
Kuruáya dialect is ǰɨ; dɨ. 'To pass' is kap. Kuruáya kab. Cf. *Tupí-G.
Kuruáya dialect is ǰɨ; dɨ. 'To pass' is kap. Kuruáya kab. Cf. *Tupí-G.
Also ǰešĩŋšĩŋ; čɨ̃ŋčɨ̃ŋ and ekɨ, to compare with *Tupí-G.
Also ǰe-tok; mɨ-tok. Kuruáya dialect is na-tug. Cf. *Tupí-G.
Reduplication of single V stem is -hVm.
Means 'bottlegourd'. Kuruáya dialect is waɛ. Cf. *Tupí-G 'plate' 05.320.
mɨsɨk-tõm is 'manioc meal', with classifier -nõm ~ -tõm, meaning 'meal'. šĩnetãʔẽ is 'manioc tapioca'; šĩn-tõm is 'manioc gruel'.
With classifier -ʔip, meaning 'wood, tree'. ako-ba is 'banana'. Cf. *Tupí-G.
Used as a classifier. Kuruáya dialect is tit. Cf. *Tupí-G.
-dɨp is a classifier for things with a flat, leaf shape, e.g. wakĩrĩma-dɨp 'piraña fish'. See 'sting ray' 03.664; 'bat' 03.591; 'paper' 18.560. Kuruáya dialect is ëib. Cf. *Tupí-G.
Also used as classifier for seed-shaped thing. Also means 'eye' 04.210.
Also classifier -dip indicates a field (cultivated or wild). Also kɨ, means 'clearing the ground'. Cf. *Tupí-G.
Also eit. Kuruáya dialect is eid. Cf. *Tupí-G.
-ʔa is a classifier, meaning 'head' 04.220. Kuruáya dialect is (ʔ)a. Cf. *Tupí-G.
-ʔa is a classifier, meaning 'head' 04.220. Kuruáya dialect is (ʔ)a. Cf. *Tupí-G.
tɨ̃mɨ̃n-tõm-tõm refers to any dough; šĩn-tõm refers to flour dough; akoba-nõm refers to banana dough.
tɨ̃mɨ̃n-tõm-tõm refers to any dough; šĩn-tõm refers to flour dough; akoba-nõm refers to banana dough.
Also imɨkonõm-konõm. 'To suckle' is imɨytitin; ǰetitin.
Also tikõn-kõn. Kuruáya dialect is (ʔ)u. Cf. *Tupí-G 'eat' 05.110.
Also tikõn-kõn. Kuruáya dialect is (ʔ)u. Cf. *Tupí-G 'eat' 05.110.
Also -okok; -erep, referring to fruit. -ɲẽm refers to meat.
Also pɨy-bit. Kuruáya dialect is buy-. Cf. *Tupí-G form.
Also ǰekõn-kõn and iʔo-om. Kuruáya dialect is kõn; (ʔ)u 'to drink'. Cf. *Tupí-G 'swallow' 05.181.
Also ǰekõn-kõn and iʔo-om. Kuruáya dialect is kõn; (ʔ)u 'to drink'. Cf. *Tupí-G 'swallow' 05.181.
Means 'dung'. Also used as a classifier. See 'intestines' 04.461.
Kuruáya dialect is bɨdu. See 'wind' 01.720. Cf. *Tupí-G.
Lit. 'dung-thin thing', with classifier -pɨ indicating a finger-shape. See 'finger' 04.340.
-ʔɨk also occurs as a classifier on hollow objects. See 'horn' 04.170.
With suffix classifier -ta, meaning 'seed, eye'. See 'star' 01.540.
Also used as a classifier. Kuruáya dialect is kam. Cf. *Tupí-G.
Also used as a classifier for 'feather-like' things. Cf. *Tupí-G.
Also used as a classifier for 'feather-like' things. Cf. *Tupí-G.
Latter also used as a classifier. Kuruáya dialect is i. Cf. *Tupí-G.
Latter also used as a classifier. Kuruáya dialect is i. Cf. *Tupí-G.

Also used as a classifier, meaning finger-shaped, as in [arami]-bɨ 'wire', from Port. 'arame'. See 'snake' 03.850; 'vein' 04.151; 'tail' 04.180. Kuruáya dialect is bɨ 'hand'. Cf. *Tupí-G 'hand' 04.330.
-ba is also used as a suffix classifier, for things that have an arm-shape. See 'banana' 08.840; 'wing' 04.392. Cf. Tupi-G.
Also used as a classifier for things with a nose-shape, i.e., 'point'. Cf. *Tupí-G.
Also used as a classifier for things with a nose-shape, i.e., 'point'. Cf. *Tupí-G.
Also -ipɨk, a classifier meaning 'shaft, ear'. as in mɨra-ipɨk, 'ear of corn'.
Used as a classifier. Kuruáya dialect is upa. Cf. *Tupí-G.
Also used as a classifier -ʔa; see 'round' 12.810. Also in 'stone' 01.440; 'owl' 03.596; 'potato' 05.700. Kuruáya dialect is (ʔ)a. Cf. Tupí-G.
Also used as a classifier -ʔa; see 'round' 12.810. Also in 'stone' 01.440; 'owl' 03.596; 'potato' 05.700. Kuruáya dialect is (ʔ)a. Cf. Tupí-G.
-dao is also used as a classifier; see 'bone' 04.160. Cf. *Tupí-G 'spine' 04.191.
-dao is also used as a classifier; see 'bone' 04.160. Cf. *Tupí-G 'spine' 04.191.
Used as a classifier; see 'finger' 04.340. Cf. *Tupí-G.
Also used as a classifier; see 'spine' 04.191.
-pɨ ~ -bɨ is a classifier, meaning finger-shaped. See 'finger' 04.340.
-bɨ is a classifier, meaning finger-shaped; see 'finger' 04.340. Kuruáya dialect is pëy.
The latter is a black monkey. Also čošio, 'coxiu'; oroʔoro, 'guariba'; sɨ̃sɨ̃t, 'macaco soim'; deko, 'coatá'; karima, 'macaco de cheiro'.
The latter is a black monkey. Also čošio, 'coxiu'; oroʔoro, 'guariba'; sɨ̃sɨ̃t, 'macaco soim'; deko, 'coatá'; karima, 'macaco de cheiro'.
Also i-ši-. Kuruáya dialect is i-ǰi. Cf. Tupí-G.
-dɨp is a classifier for leaf-shaped things. See 'leaf' 08.560.
Kuruáya dialect is aru. Other varieties are ɨ̃rɨ̃; parawa; paro. Cf. *Tupí-G.
Kuruáya dialect is aru. Other varieties are ɨ̃rɨ̃; parawa; paro. Cf. *Tupí-G.
-dɨp is a classifier for leaf-shaped things. See 'leaf' 08.560.
'Domestic animal' is wɨ̃n-ča; a 'hunt animal' is ibɨt.
Kuruáya dialect forms are ɛ; ɛn. Cf. *Tupí-G.
Kuruáya dialect forms are ɛ; ɛn. Cf. *Tupí-G.
Kuruáya dialect is up, also means 'father'. Cf. *Tupí-G. 'father' 02.350.
Kuruáya dialect is up, also means 'father'. Cf. *Tupí-G. 'father' 02.350.
Also tɨ-mɨ̃n-tiŋ-tiŋ. šidiɲ yoyoy means to smoke a rubber ball. -diŋ is a classifier for smoke-like things, as in fog 01.740; 'dust' 01.213; 'cloud' 01.730. Kuruáya dialect is tiŋ. Cf. *Tupí-G.
Also tɨ-mɨ̃n-tiŋ-tiŋ. šidiɲ yoyoy means to smoke a rubber ball. -diŋ is a classifier for smoke-like things, as in fog 01.740; 'dust' 01.213; 'cloud' 01.730. Kuruáya dialect is tiŋ. Cf. *Tupí-G.
Also means 'firewood' 01.880. Kuruáya dialect is aša. Cf. *Tupí-G.
-diŋ is a classifier for smoke-like things. See 'smoke' 01.830.
Kuruáya dialect is kabɨdu. See 'breath' 04.510. Cf. *Tupí-G.
Also kabido-diŋ, with classifier -diŋ, for smoke-like things. See 'smoke' 01.830.
Also ka-ši-e-pi-at. Kuruáya dialect is ka-ǰi. Cf. *Tupí-G.
See 'head' 04.200. Kuruáya dialect is wita-(ʔ)a. Cf. *Tupí-G.
Also means 'tree'. Used as a classifier, as in piŋa-ʔip 'fishing pole'; [rapi]ʔip 'pencil' (from Port. 'lapis'); 'banana tree' 08.840.
Used as a classifier. Also tɨmɨnʔipʔip; yop. Kuruáya dialect is (ʔ)ib. Cf. *Tupí-G.
Also means 'river' 01.360. -di is a classifier, means 'liquid', as in yɨk-pi-di 'dysentery' (lit. 'belly-inside/pain-liquid'). See 'medicine' 04.880. Cf. *Tupí-G.
-diŋ is a classifier for smoke-like things. See 'smoke' 01.830.
-diŋ is a classifier for smoke-like things. See 'smoke' 01.830.
'Red' as with urucú dye. Reduplication with vowel change. Cf. 'yellow' 15.690.
'Red' as with urucú dye. Reduplication with vowel change. Cf. 'yellow' 15.690.
Refers to dampness of water. -pɨrɨk refers to 'dry' as in meat, etc.
Kuruáya dialect is way. Cf. *Tupí-G *yay 'to mock'.
Also means 'language' 18.240. Also used as a classifier -aʔõ.
From Port. 'papel'. -dɨp is a classifier for leaf-shaped things. See 'leaf' 08.560.
Means 'pencil', from Port. 'lápis', with classifier -ʔip, meaning 'wood, tree' 01.430.
Means 'hunting horn'. -ʔɨk is a classifier used for hollow objects.
Kuruáya dialect is oub; uib. Cf. *Tupí-G.
